column1: Senior Principal IT Technologist - SAP Finance
column2: As an SAP Accounts Payable IT Technical Analyst, you will be responsible for managing and optimizing the SAP system to support Accounts Payable operations including several upstream and downstream processes       Your role in the SAP AP & EEM (Concur) IT Team involves working with the Sourcing, Accounts Payable, EEM and Treasury business and the AP (SAP, ReadSoft), EEM (Concur) and Kofax IT Support teams to conduct the following duties; Configuring and maintaining SAP Accounts Payable and Employee Expense Management (Concur) applications to meet Medtronic functional requirements (policy workflows, integrating with upstream processes of procurement, travel, event management, expenses, services, contracted services and contingent sourcing as well as with downstream processes related to integrations with banks or check management)       This individual would be responsible to configure systems for accounts payable invoice processing, ensuring 2-way and 3-way matching, workflow for non-PO based invoices, payment approvals, check and bank payments, based on payment policies and terms, manual and automated bank integrations and cash management, SOX Compliance and risk management     You will conduct the Concur Admin role liaising with SAP Concur for support and reporting requests, provision Concur user access, conduct Concur configuration to meet country allowances and develop Concur (Cognos) reports to meet business requirements     You would also be supporting current and future Accounts Payable solutions for electronic invoicing and invoice verification, invoice scanning (Kofax) and bank payment processes and other process optimizations (Dynamic Discounting and Supply Chain Finance)     You will act as a liaison between the sourcing, accounts payable and IT departments, ensuring that the SAP system aligns with the organizations Accounts Payable goals and policies     This position is expected to engage with the business and analyse and delineate requirements, draft and review function specifications, configure SAP and Concur systems for the AP & EEM functional areas, engage with development teams, plan and execute testing and eventually deploy and support the functionality in production        A Day in the Life                 o                 Manage, architect and support SAP BW4 HANA, SAP S4 and SAP HANA database, ensuring high availability and performance.              o                 Develop, Implement, and maintain SAP BW/4 HANA and SAP HANA solutions, taking a leading role on Enterprise Operational Data reporting projects.              o                 Monitor and implement SLT / Smart Data Integration for HANA to facilitate data integration and synchronization.              o                 Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and document functional requirements.              o                 Lead and support SAP projects from planning and design to implementation and maintenance.              o                 Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues and provide on-call support as needed.              o                 Leveraging cross functional knowledge as required (OS, Networking, ABAP, etc.) to identify and debug issues quickly.              o                 Ensure data security, system stability, and regulatory compliance for SAP BW/4 HANA systems.              o                 Stay up to date with SAP best practices and technology trends.                Must Have: Minimum Requirements                         Bachelor s degree                          14+ years of experience with a bachelor s degree and 8+ years of S/4 experience with an advanced degree          Nice to Have                           Previous Medtronic experience                          Extensive experience in SAP projects, with a focus on end-to-end development, SAP BW/4 HANA, SAP S/4 HANA, SAP HANA database, SAP ECC.                          Expertise in Smart Data Integration for HANA.                          Experience integrating SAP / Non-SAP ERP platforms with SAP BW/4 HANA and upstream/downstream systems (including API Development)                          Strong cross-functional knowledge on HANA Database, SAP Functional (esp. Finance and Sales), and other SAP technologies and able to translate those skills into technical solutions for issue resolution.                          Deep understanding of ABAP skills is required.                          Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.                          Effective communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams.                          Proven ability to work independently and in a team.                          Prior Pharma and/or Medical Device experience

column2: This role involves, (but not limited to) understanding development requirements, qualify development requirements, prepare high technical level design, validate technical design to avoid any conflict with existing system design, prepare detail technical design, create technical specification for any development related to these requirements. Development includes  RICEFW  (means Reports, Interface, Conversion, Enhancements, Forms and Workflow).  SAP Functional Modules in the scope are FI, CO, SD, CS, MM, PP, PM, PS, QM, HR with all key features. Thorough knowledge of  integration  with Finance, Costing, Material Management, Production, Quality and Maintenance module of SAP is essential for this role.  Role Details: Person applying for this role must be able to take up following activities: 1. Should able to interact with functional consultants as well as business representative for development requirements validation  2. Should able to deeply study existing technical system design & then should able to create a detail technical design based on new business requirements and existing system design (avoid any conflict with existing solution)  3. Should able to prepare technical specification for all kinds of development 4. Should able to develop system for new requirements as necessary   5. Should able to guide development team for desired feature development  6. Should able to build test script for unit testing and support for integration testing, user acceptance testing  7. Should able to support testing and recording the test results for various stage of testing like Unit testing, Integration testing, Volume testing, User Acceptance Testing  8. Should able to create documentation as various stage: Design Document, Technical Specification, Test Scripts & Test Results, Training document, Standard Operating Procedure as applicable  9. Should able to work in morning shifts and extend the time as per project requirements  10. Should able to coach and mentor junior team members  Qualification Details: Person applying for this role must have following qualification / experience: 1. Educational qualification: B.E / B.Tech  2. Total Experience of 6 to 8 years with at least 5 years in SAP. Must have worked on at least 2 implementation project and 2 global support project.  3. Experience of BTP, ODATAB, Ui5 and Fiori is required (at least in couple of these areas) 4. Knowledge of support project procedure (ITIL framework) is MUST (this includes communication with on-site team from offshore, reporting, team work allocation, quality checketc) 5. Knowledge of SAP ABAP in all key functionalities is MUST this includes but not limited to Module pool programing, Reports, Interfaces, Conversion including LSMW, Enhancements including user exits, Forms and Workflow. 6. Experience of bud fixing, issue resolution in a global environment is must and critical skill 7. SAP certification in SAP ABAP is preferred. Knowledge of S/4HANA is preferred but not mandatory  8. Knowledge of Japanese language is preferred but not mandatory  9. Knowledge of Authorization management / access control is must  10. Functional Knowledge of SAP SD, SAP FI is preferred but not mandatory.  11. Experience of Integration with other software via integration framework like Workato  12. Must have experience of SAP HR ABAP  13. MUST have worked on SAP ECC version and S/4 HANA version

Benefits We offer programs and plans for a healthy mind, body, wallet and life because it?? important our benefits care for the whole person. Options include a variety of health coverage options, wellbeing and support programs, retirement, vacation and sick leave, maternity, paternity & adoption leave, continuing education and training as well as a number of voluntary benefit options.  By applying for a position with Alight, you understand that, should you be made an offer, it will be contingent on your undergoing and successfully completing a background check consistent with Alight?? employment policies. Background checks may include some or all the following based on the nature of the position: SSN/SIN validation, education verification, employment verification, and criminal check, search against global sanctions and government watch lists, credit check, and/or drug test. You will be notified during the hiring process which checks are required by the position. Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion Alight is committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion. We celebrate differences and believe in fostering an environment where everyone feels valued, respected, and supported. We know that diverse teams are stronger, more innovative, and more successful. At Alight, we welcome and embrace all individuals, regardless of their background, and are dedicated to creating a culture that enables every employee to thrive. Join us in building a brighter, more inclusive future. In addition, we take affirmative action to employ and advance in the employment of qualified minorities, women, disabled persons, disabled veterans and other covered veterans. column2: As a PLM            Process Consultant           , you will be responsible for working with key client stakeholders to define improvements in the areas of efficiency, quality, cost and information security. You will evaluate business problems, their impact, and propose solutions to work around or overcome problems; define system requirements, as-is and to-be processes; mitigate risk; manage, author and execute user acceptance testing; support projects needing PLM input and help to manage and enforce system governance. You will have the opportunity to shape value-adding consulting solutions that enable our clients to meet the changing needs of the global landscape.              The PLM            Process Consultant            will blend business analysis and daily operations to deliver PLM solutions that support the development, manufacturing, and service of all Apple branded products.                 Qualification:                   Bachelors degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology or a related technical field of study.                   Responsibilities:                 Work with PLM Product Owner, Engineering, Manufacturing, Document Control and IT to determine and define the future roadmap for specific areas and applications pertaining to PLM.             Analyze business processes, needs, and requests and recommend, develop solutions using system standards and best practices             Conduct analysis of system and functional specifications and configuration then develop appropriate documentation,             Perform business process modeling, user experience modeling and basic technical architecture diagramming             Gather business requirements - Liaise with customer representatives to understand the needs of the business             Work closely with users to fully understanding their issues, requirements and challenges to help provide a solution that will be best suited for their needs.             Work on PLM solutions and integration solutions with CAD, ERP, MES and related applications, Document control processes and best practices.             Interface on a day-to-day basis with other analysts, business users, super users, and IT team members to support business operations and drive change management             Analyze the impact of changes to the corporate application landscape/enterprise Architecture.             Identify, and participate in prioritization of business capabilities and act as a catalyst for building mature processes. At least 6+ years of experience/ deep functional knowledge with PLM - Siemens Teamcenter                 Working knowledge of MCAD/ECAD/ERP/MES               Understanding of Engineering and Manufacturing workflows pertaining to BOM, ECO, ECR               Possess a strong business and customer focus with ability to interact and influence users and senior management. The ideal candidates should have 5-10 years of experience in FCCS/HFM gained from a consultancy/organization where the candidate has had direct experience with end-users from large organizations and worked on support-based projects as well. The candidate should have a sound understanding and hands-on experience in the development and implementation of FCCS/HFM. She/he should have at least 2 to 5 years of full cycle project development experiences.  Strong client-facing and communication skills, both verbal and written, are paramount, and must be willing to travel within India and overseas, if required.  J&M offers an attractive compensation package to attract and retain talent. Candidates having travel or work from office constrains need not apply. Essential Skills Required: 5-10 years experience in enhancement/development of FCCS/HFM solutions. Exposure to large multinational clients with complex structures. Ability to contribute to development workshops and training programs. Capacity to own the client and work independently. Adaptability to environments.  Ideally looking for local Mumbai or Pune based candidates or candidates ready to relocate to Mumbai or Pune.  Accounting/finance experience a plus The location will be Chennai / Bengaluru / Mumbai but travel to Australia/New Zealand/other overseas/local client sites may be required for various durations, dependent on the specifics of the projects. Develops solutions for a variety of situations and works on projects requiring evaluation and analysis. May refer to policies, practices and precedents for guidance; determines best course of action to achieve results. column2: INDIA- Technical QA Engineer About   Shift   Paradigm Shift Paradigm is a client services business that focuses on implementing and activating technology and data to make sales and marketing work. Our people bring combined experience across technology, data & analytics, business strategy and campaign operations to accelerate our clients' businesses. We keep pace with change in modern marketing and technology in order to create both effective, scalable and future-proof solutions for our clients that span both the Fortune 500 list and emerging industry leaders. We have also built strong relationships with the world's most influential martech platforms and are key partners to them and the clients. Overview The Technical QA Specialist is responsible for reviewing email campaigns before they are deployed to ensure that they are error-free, match project requirements and are structurally sound. Technical QA Specialists will work in various marketing automation platforms, such as Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Selligent Marketing Cloud, Cordial, Responsys, Emarsys, Marketo, and more. They will adhere to internal Technical QA processes and will make recommendations for process improvements and efficiencies. The Technical QA Specialist will work with internal teams to escalate errors and ensure they are resolved. This position requires a strong attention to detail and effective communication skills as the main goal of this role is to find errors and communicate with other teams to resolve them. 1/9   Individual   Responsibilities Ensure that proper checks are done for each email campaign based on the project requirements outlined in the project documentation. Ensure that email campaigns are compliant in the following areas: Project Requirements Client data is accurate and complete for the email campaigns being executed. Dynamic content has fallback options. Campaigns have been tested against live data. Documentation is up to date and logical for tests being performed. Review the setup of marketing campaigns across various platforms (Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Selligent Marketing Cloud, Cordial, Responsys, Emarsys, Marketo, etc.) Perform thorough data testing for all new automations, triggers and journeys in conjunction with appropriate teams. Review setup of complex lifecycle programs within Email Service Provider platforms. Identify errors and escalate to appropriate teams for resolution Work with other Technical QA Team members to maintain and follow internal QA standards 2/9   Take ownership of projects as they come into Technical QA, including collaboration on: Timelines Project requirements Delegating tasks to other Technical QA team members Being accountable for final approval Actively work toward a 100% external error-free rate Adhere to deadlines to ensure campaigns are executed in a timely manner Develop and document efficiencies in current and future processes Ensure process is consistent across all teams by providing. feedback to the appropriate individuals Collaborate with team members on ways to improve internal processes and client programs. Continuously further knowledge of ESP platforms and emerging trends and technologies. Familiarity with reading and writing AMPscript or other dynamic scripts. Work with data extensions and queries within Salesforce Marketing Cloud Ensure all technical questions that could impact a program have been asked and answered to the satisfaction of Technical QA department. 4/9   Team   Responsibilities Help to train and mentor entry-level staff, leading by example and providing ongoing mentorship. Experience/Qualifications Strong attention to detail Ability to work collaboratively as part of a team Self-motivated and accountable - the right candidate takes a lot of pride in their work. Organized and able to juggle multiple projects at once Strong communication skills - both written and verbal BA/BS in Marketing, Communication, Business, Web Design and Development, Computer Science, Information Technology, or related fieldor equivalent experience 4+ years tactical, hands-on experience in email marketing and marketing automation, developing and implementing automated marketing campaigns. Hands-on experience with experience with an email marketing tool (Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Selligent Marketing Cloud, Cordial, Responsys, Emarsys, Marketo, etc.) Familiarity with HTML, CSS, or other coding languages Familiarity with Amp Script, Smarty, or other scripting languages Strong knowledge of best practices for email deployment practices,data, analytics, segmentation, list management, dynamic content, testing methodologies, deliverability, etc. A team player who also works well independently, thinks creatively, solves problems, and takes initiative. 5/9   Understands email marketing operations, technology, platforms, databases, and email architecture. Has high-level understanding of the data privacy landscape in the USA and Canada. 6/9

column2: Role & responsibilities   Requirement for Developer, Lead and Architect role Compensation can go up to 40 lpa.   We are seeking a skilled Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Power Platform Developer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement (CE) and the Power Platform, with expertise in designing, developing, and implementing end-to-end solutions to meet business requirements. The candidate should possess excellent communication skills, the ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team, and a passion for staying updated with the latest advancements in the Dynamics 365 and Power Platform ecosystem. Key Responsibilities: Design, develop, and implement custom solutions within the Microsoft Dynamics 365 CE environment, leveraging the Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI) as needed. Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and analyze business requirements, and translate them into technical specifications and solution designs. Develop and customize Dynamics 365 CE entities, forms, views, workflows, and plugins to meet business needs. Implement integrations between Dynamics 365 CE and other systems using web services, APIs, and middleware platforms. Provide technical leadership and guidance to development teams, ensuring adherence to best practices, coding standards, and project timelines. Conduct code reviews, performance optimizations, and troubleshooting to ensure the stability and scalability of Dynamics 365 CE solutions. Stay updated with the latest developments in Dynamics 365 CE, Power Platform, and related technologies, and recommend best practices and solutions to enhance system capabilities. Collaborate with cross-functional teams including business analysts, solution architects, and quality assurance testers to deliver high-quality solutions. Preferred candidate profile     Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field. Minimum of 4 years of hands-on experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement (CE), including customization, configuration, and development. Proficiency in building end-to-end solutions using the Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI). Strong technical skills in .NET framework, C#, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and related web technologies. Experience with customizations and extensions within Dynamics 365 CE, including entity model customization, form scripting, workflow automation, and plugin development. Knowledge of data integration techniques and tools, such as Azure Data Factory, Azure Logic Apps, or SSIS. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex business requirements into technical solutions. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Microsoft certifications in Dynamics 365 CE and Power Platform are a plus. Location- PAN India Wipro locations (Bangalore, Hyderabad, Chennai, Gurgaon, Greater Noida, Pune, Kolkata, Mumbai) Notice- Immediate to 30 days Perks and benefits   Best of industry standard

column2: Who are we looking for               You have a natural desire to help people understand complicated subjects. You will design and develop technical product content, both inside and outside of the user interface (UI), with a focus on clarity, accuracy, and the user experience.               You should have:           Excellent writing skills with strong research skills.                   Excellent verbal and written communication skills.                   Ability to work independently, with a strong sense of responsibility and commitment to teamwork.                   Ability to be agile with dynamic schedules and priorities.                   Passion to solve challenging problems and think of new ways to deliver better content to our clients & global users.                   What you ll do: Role & Responsibilities             You will be responsible to design, develop, and publish Infosec Venture s technical content that is easy to use and understand even for a non-technical person. The content can take various forms but not limited to: content embedded in the UI (UX writing like welcome instructions, product tours, messages, etc.) product manual, user guide, multimedia (for example, videos, graphics), Support content, chatbots, training, White Papers, Case Studies, reports, and community content.                   Simplify technically complex concepts and details from multiple sources into consumable content that drives user actions. Deliver clear, inclusive, accessible, and translated content for a global audience.                   Should have a knack to understand complex use cases and technology, and produce a simple explanation to them.                   Work closely with Product Management, Design, Development, Marketing, Support, Sales, Training, to tell a cohesive product story. Use expertise and user empathy to influence product design decisions to deliver the best user experiences we can for our clients.                   Learn complex concepts of Cybersecurity, and communicate the information in a way that is engaging and easily understood by users.                   Report issues with products, demo(s), website, etc. found during exploration                       Required Technical and Professional Expertise                 2-5 Years of experience in IT Industry as a technical writer, Cybersecurity preferred but not necessary.               Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English with a passion for great storytelling               Modelling and formatting content into viable, feasible, and desirable solutions               Researching and studying the subject and context to inform content.               Writing, curating, and editing content for accuracy, clarity, and usability, at every level of the progressive disclosure model.               Proven experience working under strict deadlines and the ability to work quickly and accurately in a fast - paced environment               Simplifying complex content for users               Creating content that drives user actions               Defining and applying consistent voice and tone throughout content journey               Defining content goals and journeys based on user or customer goals                       Nice-to-have Skills/Experience                 Degree in Bachelor of Technology is preferred but not necessary.               Previous experience in a product company is a plus.               Passionate about working and growing with a Start-up               Ambitious to perform and create a legacy to leave behind

column2: SAP Security is a crucial aspect of the SAP system, responsible for ensuring the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the data processed by the system. A SAP Security professional is responsible for:     1.Designing and implementing SAP security strategies and policies to secure the SAP landscape     2.Configuring user access, authorization, and authentication in SAP systems     3.Monitoring and auditing SAP system logs to detect potential security breaches     4.Ensuring data privacy and compliance with relevant regulations and standards     5.Maintaining and updating SAP security documentation     6.Providing technical support to end-users and addressing their security-related queries     7.Keeping abreast of new threats and technologies related to SAP security and proactively implementing measures to mitigate them.     The ideal candidate should have a good understanding of SAP security best practices, in-depth knowledge of SAP authorization concepts, experience with SAP GRC, and familiarity with security technologies such as firewalls, encryption, and identity management solutions.

column2: We are seeking an experienced SAP Employee Central Consultant to join our team      As an SAP Employee Central Consultant, you will be responsible for providing expertise in the implementation, configuration, and support of SAP Employee Central modules      You will work closely with clients to understand their HR business processes and requirements, and translate them into effective system solutions      The ideal candidate should have at least 5 years of experience working as an SAP Employee Central Consultant, with a strong background in HR and payroll processes                  Roles and Responsibilities:              Collaborate with clients to gather and analyze their HR business requirements, and provide expert advice on best practices and system capabilities.      Design and configure SAP Employee Central modules based on client requirements, ensuring the system meets their HR business processes.      Develop functional specifications, including data mapping, system configurations, and integration requirements.      Conduct system testing, including unit testing, integration testing, and user acceptance testing, to ensure the system is functioning as expected.      Provide end-user training on SAP Employee Central functionality and support during the implementation phase.      Assist in data migration activities, including data cleansing, transformation, and loading into the SAP Employee Central system.      Collaborate with technical teams to ensure successful integration between SAP Employee Central and other systems.      Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to SAP Employee Central configuration, functionality, and data.      Stay updated with the latest SAP Employee Central releases, new features, and best practices, and provide recommendations for system enhancements.      Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support the overall HR technology landscape and integration with other HR systems.      Develop and maintain documentation, including system configurations, functional specifications, and user manuals.      Assist in post-implementation support and provide ongoing maintenance and support to clients.      Monitor system performance and proactively identify areas for improvement or optimization.      Stay informed about industry trends and developments related to HR systems and technologies.      Demonstrate excellent communication skills and the ability to effectively collaborate with clients, stakeholders, and team members.          Required Skills SAP, EC, Employee Central
column11: data cleansing, System testing, Payroll, Data migration, SAP, Integration testing, HR, Unit testing, data mapping, User acceptance testing

column2: Overview Come and join us!  Do you want to advance your career with the worlds first cloud company? Since 1998, Oracle NetSuite has been on a mission to deliver an agile, unified application suite that gives leaders a complete view into their business. Our team is growing, and were looking for people like you to help us make a global impact. As the leading cloud business system, NetSuite includes financials, inventory management, HR, professional services automation, commerce, and more. Tens of thousands of customers all over the world trust NetSuite to give their businesses the visibility, agility, and control needed to make data-informed decisions quickly.  NetSuite is a place where you can build your career and have fun while doing so! Were invested in our people, our customers, and the community. As part of Oracle, our benefits are second to none. Joining our passionate team means that youre ready to take your career to the next level. With priceless learning opportunities, strong support, incredible innovation, and volunteer opportunities, NetSuite is committed to creating a workplace where everyone feels empowered and set up for success. Summary: The Shared Services Group within Oracle NetSuite Professional Services is chartered to assist and guide our customers by developing analytic reporting strategies and solutions, creating implementation roadmaps, performing assessments, and full-life cycle implementations of analytics solutions. We are looking for an experienced consultant/developer with significant hands-on experience working with NetSuite SuiteAnalytics Connect, integration, ETL and data warehouse solutions to assist Oracle NetSuite?? clients with their data warehouse implementation. Knowledge of related solutions such as Oracle Analytics Cloud (OAC) and NetSuite SuiteAnalytics Connect, and Autonomous Data Warehouse (ADW) and Oracle Fusion Analytics Warehouse (FAW) desired. Key Responsibilities: Consultatively gathering      customer requirements and collaborate with the customer to define the      business challenge the customer is attempting to better understand with      data Taking the defined      business objective, using the understanding of the data model and      producing analytics to deliver actionable insights Identify new data and      product patterns through data mining and communicate those complex      concepts and the results of the analyses in a clear and effective manner      through creative visualization directly to company executives Extend the data warehouse      by incorporating data from 3rd party datasets/applications Build data pipelines from      multiple data sources by performing necessary ETL tasks including      processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for      analysis Lead project delivery as a      technical expert when implementing solutions. Develop solutions that      follow product development guidelines and are in-line with established      design standards and approved architectures. Transfer product knowledge      to customers to reinforce training and ensure adoption. Resolve or advance client      issues as appropriate to support and engineering teams. Develop and maintain      up-to-date knowledge of Oracle and NetSuite analytics, data integration      products and service offerings. Work closely with the      NetSuite Product Team to influence design, product features and roadmap. Attend internal meetings      and collaborate by sharing knowledge and standard methodologies within the      practice including mentoring sessions for junior resources, and other      central initiatives. Support pre-sales efforts      and drive technology adoption by positioning Oracle NetSuite Consulting      services. Preferred Qualifications/Skills include: At least 8 to 10 years of      experience in OBIEE/Hyperion/Oracle Analytics Cloud, Data Warehouse, and      SQL experience ideally with integration to/from Oracle NetSuite      Application Solid understanding of      Oracle Database, Data Modelling, Oracle SQL Developer, Data Warehouse      concepts, advanced analytics concepts, and implementation. Experience implementing      and using Big Data and visualization techniques, tools, and technologies      (Spark, Kafka, Tableau, etc.) Experience querying      databases and using statistical computer languages: R, Python, SLQ, etc. Experience with following      Oracle solutions is greatly desired: Autonomous Data Warehouse (ADW),      Oracle Analytics Cloud (OAC), NetSuite SuiteAnalytics Connect, Oracle      Fusion Analytics Warehouse (FAW), JDBC/ODBC, ADO.net  Able to perform complex      problem solving and to work closely with NetSuite Support and Product      Management Experience with one or      more of the following business applications: NetSuite, SAP, Siebel,      Oracle, QuickBooks, Great Plains, Salesforce.com, MAS 90, PeopleSoft, JD      Edwards Experience in data design,      data modeling, data mapping, data interrogation, data quality, and master      data management is desired Good interpersonal and      communication skills Experience architecting      and provisioning/configuring cloud-based data warehouse and/or database      solutions is desired Travel Modest to moderate, as     appropriate.  Timings NA shift6PM to 3AM IST If this sounds like you, we hope to meet you! In order to nurture the talent that makes this happen, we are committed to an inclusive culture that celebrates and values diverse insights and perspectives, a workforce that inspires thought leadership and innovation. column2: Responsibilities A day in the life of an Infoscion As part of the Infosys consulting team, your primary role would be to get to the heart of customer issues, diagnose problem areas, design innovative solutions and facilitate deployment resulting in client delight. You will develop a proposal by owning parts of the proposal document and by giving inputs in solution design based on areas of expertise.  You will plan the activities of configuration, configure the product as per the design, conduct conference room pilots and will assist in resolving any queries related to requirements and solution design You will conduct solution/product demonstrations, POC/Proof of Technology workshops and prepare effort estimates which suit the customer budgetary requirements and are in line with organizations financial guidelines  Actively lead small projects and contribute to unit-level and organizational initiatives with an objective of providing high quality value adding solutions to customers. If you think you fit right in to help our clients navigate their next in their digital transformation journey, this is the place for you! Technical and Professional Requirements: Must have bachelors or equivalent degree, with a minimum of 5 years of experience in Portal and Mobile application development with SAP Platforms  Should have expertise in software development & programming using HTML5, JavaScript, Node.js, SAPUI5 and Fiori Experience in developing SAP Cloud Platform based applications is a plus Must have experience in Fiori apps implementation including configurations Build Custom Fiori and extend Fiori applications using SAP Cloud Platform and eclipse Experience working with SAP Web IDE and different http services integration like REST/Web service Must have experience in Fiori Design patterns, UI Theme designer and Fiori Launchpad configurations and database experience with SAP or S/4 HANA Should be able to provide techno-functional support on SAP UI/UX functionality (SAP Fiori) Assist in the integration of front-end UI/UX components with back-end technical and application components to meet business requirements  Preferred Skills: Technology->SAP Technical->SAP Fiori  Technology->SAP Technical->SAP UI5  Additional Responsibilities: Ability to develop value-creating strategies and models that enable clients to innovate, drive growth and increase their business profitability  Good knowledge on software configuration management systems Awareness of latest technologies and Industry trends  Logical thinking and problem solving skills along with an ability to collaborate Understanding of the financial processes for various types of projects and the various pricing models available Ability to assess the current processes, identify improvement areas and suggest the technology solutions  One or two industry domain knowledge  Client Interfacing skills Project and Team management  Location of posting - Infosys Ltd. is committed to ensuring you have the best experience throughout your journey with us. We currently have open positions in a number of locations across India - Bangalore, Pune, Hyderabad, Chennai, Chandigarh, Trivandrum, Indore, Nagpur, Mangalore, Noida, Bhubaneswar, Coimbatore, Mumbai, Jaipur, Vizag, Kolkata. MysoreWhile we work in accordance with business requirements, we shall strive to offer you the location of your choice, where possible. column2: Software Developers at IBM are the backbone of our strategic initiatives to design, code, test, and provide industry-leading solutions that make the world run today - planes and trains take off on time, bank transactions complete in the blink of an eye and the world remains safe because of the work our software developers do. Whether you are working on projects internally or for a client, software development is critical to the success of IBM and our clients worldwide. At IBM, you will use the latest software development tools, techniques and approaches and work with leading minds in the industry to build solutions you can be proud of. Your Role and Responsibilities As part of Technology Expert Labs - Global Delivery Center (TEL - GDC) and IBM Sterling Data Exchange (SDE) - Center of Excellence (CoE), you will have the opportunity to be part of a team of IBM Delivery Consultants and Subject Matter Experts delivering expert services to customers and partners across markets on IBM Software solutions and use cases. As an IBM Sterling Data Exchange practitioner, you would be required to continuosly learn and upgrade your skillset and apply your strong product/ domain/ solution/ technical/ consulting expertise with IBM Sterling B2B Integration (B2Bi) and Managed File Transfer (MFT) suite of offerings, to help customers worldwide - during solution definition, design, install and configuration, custom implementation, validation, go-live, warranty phases as well as support enablement, proof of concepts (pre-sales) and critical situations. As an IBM Sterling Data Exchange - Delivery Consultant, you will: #ISATSELQ224 Required Technical and Professional Expertise 2 to 6 years of strong hands-on experience using IBM Sterling B2B Integration & Managed File Transfer products and solutions: IBM Sterling B2B Integrator (B2BI) IBM Sterling File Gateway (SFG) IBM Sterling Secure Proxy (SSP) IBM Sterling External Authentication Server (SEAS) IBM Sterling Control Center Monitor (ICC/ CCM) # Readiness and experience playing remote and/ or customer-facing SME roles within and outside India Experience supporting global delivery across multiple timezones with a strong customer success mindset and focus  Solution, Consulting and Domain skills Strong Map and business process development Experience with Requirements Analysis, Design, Implementation, Validation/Testing, Go-live, Post go-live assistance Experience with Upgrades and Migrations, Deployments (on-premise or cloud, legacy or containerized) Experience with Agile delivery practices and tools Hands-on experience with Install and Config, Enviroment setup, apply ifixes Experience with engaging Product Support/ Engineering for raising and resolving product related issues Ability to work independently as an SME, or under the guidance of Architect/Lead or IBM SME if assigned  Strong Technology Expertise Programming: Java, XML, XSLT, XPath, JSON, JavaScript, REST APIs Operating Systems: Linux/RHEL, Unix, Windows & Scripting. Optional: z/OS Databases: DB2, SQL Server, Oracle EDI Standards: X12, EDIFACT, ODETTE, SWIFT, HIPPA etc in Financial Services, Healthcare etc domains Communication protocols (FTP/SFTP/AS2 etc) Certificates & Encryption (PGP) General skills Excellent analytical, problem solving, articulation, client-handling skills coupled with project/ team leading abilities Good communication skills - being proactive about weekly status, update on issues or defects Prepare and provide client presentations including demos as per project requirement Possess innovative mindset. Keen to explore, learn new things and share/apply them to solve problems Works well with team Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise Knowledge of below IBM Sterling Data Exchange products: IBM Sterling Connect:Direct (CD) IBM Sterling Control Center Director (CCD) IBM Sterling Global Mailbox (GM) IBM Sterling Partner Engagement Manager (PEM) IBM Transformation Extender/ Advanced (ITX/ ITXA) Sound knowledge and familiarity with:  Cloud (AWS/Azure/GCP/OCI/IBM Cloud) Containerization (Docker & Kubernetes)  AI-ML, Generative AI (LLM) and Python DevOps, CI/CD toolchain  Open Source software/ tools (Kakfa, Elastic Search, Kibana etc)

column1: Trainee IT Solutions Consultant - (Udupi/Manipal candidates only)
column2: The Eclipse Group has over 35 years experience providing enterprise-class business management solutions to help organisations automate and streamline their finance and accounting function. This includes significant international expertise, working with over 2,000 organisations in 70+ countries.  Role & responsibilities   The Trainee IT Solutions Consultant will fit within our global consultancy team and report to Madhur Subhash, Managing Director of Eclipse India. The successful candidates will work on both new and existing projects and assist in providing support for our clients. They will:  Work closely with experienced consultants providing business requirements analysis, system design, configuration and training services for a variety of clients.  Implement and deploy financial and business management solutions.  As competency develops, take responsibility for specific deliverables including software installation and configuration, customisation and user acceptance testing.  Provide system integration, data migration, user training and go-live support services throughout the complete project life cycle.  The role also involves accepting and resolving support tickets, maintaining SLAs, and a high level of client communication Preferred candidate profile   This role is suited towards someone who is looking to kick start their career in IT Consultancy. This is an exciting opportunity to join a new subsidiary company and make an impact. The successful candidates should have a distinct interest in software programming, business intelligence, client-facing roles. They should also have some experience of developing API / web service integrations. Required technical skills:  Back-end programming or any OOPS programming skills (any OOPS language is sufficient) and python scripting  Database  a good knowledge of RDBMS systems and SQL programming  Front-end programming  any front-end programming language (HTML, CSS).  API knowledge (including POSTMAN testing  Technical problem-solving skills Required soft skills:  Strong verbal, listening and written communication skills  Ability to work effectively as part of a team, as well as independently  Excellent time management  Adaptability skills Perks and benefits    A competitive salary  Full on-the-job training  Opportunity to gain international solution implementation experience.  Work with one of the most experienced teams operating in this business sector that will help you to realise your full potential.  Excellent career progression opportunities.

column2: SAP BW (Business Warehouse) is a data warehousing solution offered by SAP.          A job description for an SAP BW professional typically includes the following responsibilities:         Design, implementation, and maintenance of data warehousing systems using SAP BW.     Understanding of business requirements and translating them into SAP BW solutions.     Developing, testing and deploying ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to populate data into SAP BW.     Design and maintenance of SAP BW data models, including InfoObjects, InfoCubes, MultiProviders, and DataStore Objects.     Supporting the SAP BW environment and ensuring performance, availability, and scalability of the system.     Collaborating with other teams such as SAP Basis, ABAP Development, and Business Intelligence to ensure seamless integration with other SAP systems.     Designing, building and maintaining SAP BW reports and dashboards using tools such as SAP BusinessObjects.     Mentoring and training other team members on SAP BW best practices.     The ideal candidate for this role should have a strong understanding of data warehousing concepts, experience with SAP BW and its related tools, excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams.

You will plan the activities of configuration, configure the product as per the design, conduct conference room pilots and will assist in resolving any queries related to requirements and solution design You will conduct solution/product demonstrations, POC/Proof of Technology workshops and prepare effort estimates which suit the customer budgetary requirements and are in line with organizations financial guidelines  Actively lead small projects and contribute to unit-level and organizational initiatives with an objective of providing high quality value adding solutions to customers. If you think you fit right in to help our clients navigate their next in their digital transformation journey, this is the place for you! Technical and Professional Requirements: Requires minimum 5 years of experience in developing, deploying and configuring applications on Cloud Foundry using SAP CAPM. Experience creating and configuring launch pad sites using BTP portal service/Launchpad Service/WorkZone. Knowledge of BTP services like workflow management, Hana cloud, XSUAA, Document Service etc & configuring destinations to cloud and on-premise systems and using them in applications. Knowledge about platform operations like Identity Provider configuration, assertion-based mapping for authorization, role collection configuration etc. Experience consuming OAuth protected REST APIs in applications. Knowledge of Java or Node JS programming language is a must. Experience creating microservices using Spring Boot framework or NodeJS based frameworks. Experience using Git for SCM.  Preferred Skills: Technology->SAP Technical->SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP)  Additional Responsibilities: Ability to develop value-creating strategies and models that enable clients to innovate, drive growth and increase their business profitability  Good knowledge on software configuration management systems Awareness of latest technologies and Industry trends  Logical thinking and problem solving skills along with an ability to collaborate Understanding of the financial processes for various types of projects and the various pricing models available Ability to assess the current processes, identify improvement areas and suggest the technology solutions  One or two industry domain knowledge  Client Interfacing skills Project and Team management Location of posting - Infosys Ltd. is committed to ensuring you have the best experience throughout your journey with us. We currently have open positions in a number of locations across India - Bangalore, Pune, Hyderabad, Chennai, Chandigarh, Trivandrum, Indore, Nagpur, Mangalore, Noida, Bhubaneswar, Coimbatore, Mumbai, Jaipur, Vizag, Kolkata, Mysore. While we work in accordance with business requirements, we shall strive to offer you the location of your choice, where possible.  Educational Requirements Bachelor of Engineering  Service Line Enterprise Package Application Services *  Location of posting is subject to business requirements

column1: Package Consultant: Oracle Cloud HCM Payroll
column2: A career in IBM Consulting is rooted by long-term relationships and close collaboration with clients across the globe. You'll work with visionaries across multiple industries to improve the hybrid cloud and AI journey for the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Your ability to accelerate impact and make meaningful change for your clients is enabled by our strategic partner ecosystem and our robust technology platforms across the IBM portfolio; including Software and Red Hat. Curiosity and a constant quest for knowledge serve as the foundation to success in IBM Consulting. In your role, you'll be encouraged to challenge the norm, investigate ideas outside of your role, and come up with creative solutions resulting in ground breaking impact for a wide network of clients. Our culture of evolution and empathy centers on long-term career growth and development opportunities in an environment that embraces your unique skills and experience. Your Role and Responsibilities As a Consultant you will serve as a client-facing practitioner who sells, leads and implements expert services utilizing the breadth of IBM's offerings and technologies. A successful Consultant is regarded by clients as a trusted business advisor who collaborates to provide innovative solutions used to solve the most challenging business problems. You will work developing solutions that excel at user experience, style, performance, reliability, and scalability to reduce costs and improve profit and shareholder value. Your primary responsibilities include: Shape solutions within Oracle Cloud based on key client requirements following Agile methodology. Configure and test applications to check that it meets business requirements. Work under a continued improvement culture, challenging ideas and finding solutions to problems. Good and Effective Communication skill to understand the requirement and articulate the solution. Required Technical and Professional Expertise Functional Expertise in Oracle Cloud Payroll. Completed at least 4 full life cycle implementations of HCM Cloud projects with payroll in 2 projects. Identify functionality gaps and develop solutions to them. Should be responsible for functional solutions and implement the solution framework. Configure and test the applications as per business requirements. Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise Excellent written and verbal interpersonal skills for coordinating across teams. Oracle Payroll, Oracle HCM, HCM Extract, BI Publisher. Certification in Cloud is an advantage.

column2: Role & responsibilities   Develops and delivers detailed technology solutions through consulting project activities. Responsibilities include client identification through final invoicing for engagements requiring varied interpersonal and technical skills. Technical responsibilities include problem identification, system architecture definition, hardware/software specification and/or design, implementation, testing, client training, and solution deployment. Performance is typically evaluated based on utilization, (i.e., billable hours). Project management activities include interaction with company and client managers and cost/schedule monitoring. May have some financial responsibilities including project cost estimating, proposal generation, and invoicing. May participate in sales and proposal presentations in addition to completing ongoing team account activities. Identifies additional product/services opportunities in customer organization. Performance is typically measured by the capture of the consulting engagement and/or delivery of agreed solutions within budgeted hours.    Opportunity The Learning Technology Consultant is part of the Customer Onboarding team for Adobe Learning Manager (ALM) and is a key member who works on onboarding projects and is the technology advisor to our customers. He/She would be instrumental in understanding customer requirements, and working with internal Adobe teams to effectively onboard the customer by developing and delivering detailed technology solutions through consulting project activities. Technical responsibilities include problem identification, system architecture definition, hardware/software specification and/or design, implementation, testing, client training, and solution deployment. Project management activities include interaction with company and client managers and schedule monitoring. Performance is typically measured by the capture of the consulting engagement and/or delivery of agreed solutions within budgeted hours.? Key Skills Determine Customer Requirements The Technology Consultant is responsible for translating business requirements into functional requirements for Adobe Learning Manager that can be used to define digital solutions within the framework of SaaS systems. Demonstrated experience conducting discovery workshops to identify techno-functional requirements for SAAS systems, Customer Engagement The Technology Consultant should have a proven track record of managing customers and end-to-end implementation of SAAS solutions. The ability to "translate" business requirements to implementation paths is critical. He/She will have to work quickly to establish trust and be the technology advisor on the engagement. Strong consulting and Program Management This role requires the ability to work on multiple projects at various stages of onboarding simultaneously. He/She must be able to manage their own schedules to ensure success of the Projects. Effectively communicate the project status, issues, risks in a timely manner to various stakeholders. Learning Technology and Learning Domain Expertise The incumbent must be familiar with the technologies that drive learning solutions, at an expert level. Experience in implementing/ supporting SAAS-based solutions preferably LMS/CMS. Demonstrated experience in system integrations using APIs and practical application of Internet protocols: HTTP, SMTP, DNS, LDAP, and FTP is critical. Stakeholder Management The Consultant is responsible for managing internal stakeholders - working with Engineering, Product Management, Support, and Customer Success teams, and bringing in their expertise as required. They will need to demonstrate a level of competence in having "convincing conversations" with senior leadership both internally within Adobe, Partners, Preferred candidate profile   Perks and benefits

column2: Peoplesoft HCM Technical Consultant Hybrid (3 days WFO/2 days WFH) Chennai/Bangalore/Mumbai/Pune/Noida/Coimbatore Job Description: As a PeopleSoft HCM Technical Consultant, you will be responsible for leveraging your expertise in PeopleSoft Human Capital Management (HCM) to provide technical support and solutions to clients.  Your primary focus will be on designing, developing, implementing, and maintaining PeopleSoft HCM modules to meet the specific needs of our clients. Key Responsibilities: Technical Analysis: Conduct thorough analysis of client requirements and translate them into technical specifications.  Collaborate with business analysts and functional consultants to understand the business processes and recommend technical solutions. Development: Design, develop, customize, and test PeopleSoft HCM applications, reports,      interfaces, and integrations using PeopleTools, Application Engine, Component Interface, Integration Broker, and other relevant tools and technologies. Configuration: Configure and maintain PeopleSoft HCM modules, including Core HR, NA      Payroll to align with client requirements. Data Migration: Lead data migration activities, including data mapping,      extraction, transformation, and loading, ensuring data integrity and      accuracy throughout the process. Documentation:      Prepare technical design documents, installation guides, configuration      guides, and other documentation as required to support the implementation      and maintenance of PeopleSoft HCM solutions. Support:      Provide technical support and troubleshooting assistance to clients,      including analyzing and resolving system issues, debugging code, and      implementing patches and upgrades. Qualifications: Bachelors      degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. Strong      experience in PeopleSoft HCM application development and customization,      with expertise in PeopleTools, Application Engine, Component Interface,      SQR and other relevant tools. Proficiency      in PeopleSoft HCM modules such as Core HR, NA Payroll. Experience      with PeopleSoft HCM data migration, performance tuning, and integration      with third-party systems. Excellent      analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills. Ability      to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment. Relevant      PeopleSoft certifications (optional but preferred). Prior      experience in consulting or client-facing roles (preferred). Join      our team and play a pivotal role in delivering innovative PeopleSoft HCM      solutions that drive business success for our clients!

column2: A career in IBM Consulting is rooted by long-term relationships and close collaboration with clients across the globe. You'll work with visionaries across multiple industries to improve the hybrid cloud and AI journey for the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Your ability to accelerate impact and make meaningful change for your clients is enabled by our strategic partner ecosystem and our robust technology platforms across the IBM portfolio; including Software and Red Hat. Curiosity and a constant quest for knowledge serve as the foundation to success in IBM Consulting. In your role, you'll be encouraged to challenge the norm, investigate ideas outside of your role, and come up with creative solutions resulting in ground breaking impact for a wide network of clients. Our culture of evolution and empathy centers on long-term career growth and development opportunities in an environment that embraces your unique skills and experience. Your Role and Responsibilities As a consultant you will serve as a client-facing practitioner who sells, leads and implements expert services utilizing the breadth of IBM's offerings and technologies. A successful Consultant is regarded by clients as a trusted business advisor who collaborates to provide innovative solutions used to solve the most challenging business problems. You will work developing solutions that excel at user experience, style, performance, reliability and scalability to reduce costs and improve profit and shareholder value. Your primary responsibilities include: Build, automate and release solutions based on clients priorities and requirements. Explore and discover risks and resolving issues that affect release scope, schedule and quality and bring to the table potential solutions. Make sure that all integration solutions meet the client specifications and are delivered on time. Required Technical and Professional Expertise Implementation Certified in Hyperion HFM version 11.1.2.4/FCCS. Strong experience in writing and maintain clear, concise functional and technical specifications on HFM applications and business system processes.  5+ years of experience working with HFM and FDMEE.Strong experience in developing and maintaining FDMEE mappings, validation rules and new integration set up. Create technical solutions to meet business requirements Implement plans to test business and functional processes. Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise Sound functional knowledge of financial process like Income Statement, Balance Sheet and Cash flow. Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment. Proficient on all components of HFM like Metadata setup, Ownership Management, Rules, Journals, Currency translation, Consolidation, and data integration with downstream systems.

column2: Your Role and Responsibilities IBM's Purpose is to be essential to our clients, to the world and one another and we are confident that together as IBMers we will drive this purpose. Joining IBM is about joining a culture of openness, teamwork, trust, and the invitation and expectation to have a voice. Join us and Do your Best Work Ever.IBM is recognized gold standard for inclusion, reflected in winning, to name few, the 2018 Catalyst Award for advancing women in business, the National Award Best Employer of People with Disabilities and being named one of the top 5 2018 Top Companies for Women Technologists for building an inclusive workplace - We advocate for fairness and equality as everyone is, and always has been, welcome at IBM.We at IBM Global Business Services (GBS) are a dynamic group of Business, Strategy and Technology professionals - a specific source of market-leading Industry Consulting, Application and Business process management, supported by the industry's most sophisticated outcome-based delivery model. All designed to be the Digital Reinvention partner for leading clients across the world - providing value-led and asset-powered end to end solutions.With a global footprint in over 170 countries, we are empowering clients to build upon their tremendous heritage in Application Innovation processes and also transform them to a Cloud, Cognitive and Social centric world. With skills across six sectors and 17 industries, all major service lines and competencies, IBM's GBS is a promising business unit in itself to be a part of.Through our unique global delivery network; IBM offers global expertise coupled with a deep understanding of local capabilities, markets and cultures you could be part of and partner on some great projects with some of the best corporations in the world across geographies. You will come with... Knowledge and experience in implementation planning, fit analysis, configuration, testing, rollout and post-implementation support. Experience in working with teams to prioritize work and drive system solutions by clearly articulating business needs How we'll help you grow:  You'll have access to all the technical and management training courses to become the expert you want to be You'll learn directly from experienced developers in the field, our team leads love to mento You have the opportunity to work in many different areas to figure out what really excites you. Required Technical and Professional Expertise At least 12+ plus years of experience in SAP SD CRM FICA module of which 4 years of experience on C/4 HANA billing or BRIM At least 3 full life cycle project implementation experience of SAP C/4 HANA billing or BRIM Functional expertise in several BRIM process areas including Subscription Order Management, Convergent Mediation, Convergent Charging, Convergent Invoicing, FI-CA and Customer Financial Management and overall application architecture of BRIM. Experience with S4 HANA Customer Management for management of Master data such as Business Partner Contract account and CRM SOM and it's integration with different modules of ERP.  SOM experience to include: Subscription Order Management within BRIM, Business Agreements, Provider Order, Provider Contracts & Order Distribution and Product Setup.  Experience with SAP Convergent mediation by Digital route to integrate and data streams flowing to SAP BRIM from external systems. Convergent Charging experience to include: pricing and charging logic related to services and offerings Convergent Invoicing experience to include: Consumption Items, Billable Items, Billable Item Class Configuration, billing item selection, aggregation, collective billing and reversal principles, Invoicing Integration with Tax and posting in Accounts Receivable (AR). Then, this is the right place for you! Welcome to a host of exciting global opportunities within Accenture Strategy & Consulting's Customer, Sales & Service practice. The Practice A Brief Sketch The  practice is aligned to the  Global Network  Practice of Accenture and works with clients across their marketing,  sales  and services functions. As part of the team, you will provide transformation services driven by key offerings like Living Marketing, Connected Commerce and Next-Generation Customer Care. These services help our clients become living businesses by  optimizing  their marketing,  sales  and customer service strategy, thereby driving cost reduction, revenue enhancement, customer satisfaction and  impacting  front end business metrics in a positive manner. You will work closely with our clients as consulting professionals who design,  build  and implement initiatives that can help enhance business performance. As part of the team, you will drive the following  Gather requirements, Strategize and shape (build & run) the Client's digital Marketing Audience management programs that deliver high performance profiles for segmentation & activation across Digital channels (omni channel). I.e. Plan, design, Implement & integrate proprietary products like Adobe Audience Manager, Data management platform/Customer data platform as well as working with partners to leverage audience management capabilities offered by the ecosystem player e.g. Google Advertising data Hub/2nd party, 3rd party data exchanges/ Partnership automation platforms, DSPs, etc.  Understand and convey the impact of regulations like CCPA, GDPR and client's own internal or industry regulation on data gathering and management. should be able to guide towards privacy by design, consent management for customer profile activation across digital marketing channels  Value realization from Digital audience management through collaboration with Data science teams, digital agencies, Advertising and campaign teams to enable contextual insights and decisioning, and various marketing use cases. Design Data cleaning, transformation, and integration approach from various data sources into CDP/DMP.  Evaluate and recommend new ways of data management through CDP and how it connects into the broader marketing technology landscape (campaign management and insight generation).  Identify, scope andpartner with technology solution providers, client's IT, BU teams, compliance, and marketing agencies to deliver the best solution meeting the needs of our clients.  Plan, design, implement & integrate CDP solutions such as Adobe Experience Platform RT CDP and work with partners to leveragevarious data management capabilities offered these solutions.  Bring  your best  skills  forward  to e xcel at the role : Conduct vendor assessment, client's current data management capabilities. Provide recommendations on optimizing the same.  Research, evaluate and recommend new ways of data management, CDP evolution and how they connect into the broader marketing technology landscape.  Identify, Scope & Partner/ team with technology solution providers, client's IT, BIU teams, compliance, and marketing agencies to deliver the best solution meeting the needs of our clients  Ability to orchestrate and implement integrations (including API based/ file-based integrations) b/w tools/platforms of different vendors/ Martech/Adtech components/ data sources.  Stay abreast of MarTech landscape & engage ecosystem players/vendors to ensure best in class Digital audience management capabilities for clients. Propose and conduct pilots as needed  Strong project management skills:ability to mobilize and organize across multiple stakeholders (client and internal) and projects  Maintains digital marketing platform team by counseling and mentoring employees, and planning, monitoring, and appraising job results.  Aside from client delivery, the selected candidate will also drive business development efforts and thought leadership in the digital marketing platform space  Read about us. Qualification Y our  experi ence counts! Proven working experience (5+ Years) in digital data management/ audience management and relevant marketing technology solutions (including implementations), particularly within the industry (E-Commerce, CPG, Telecom, Healthcare, Financial services etc.) Profile & segmentation:Experience building Data management platform capability preferably with tools like Adobe Audience Manager to generate profiles & segments for onsite and paid media activation Data Partnerships:Identify and build capabilities that enable access to 2nd as well as 3rd party data for activation. Working knowledge of ad serving tools, programmatic channels, tag management platforms (GTM, Launch, Tealium etc.) Experience working with Ads data hub, ad platforms and their API' s i.e. Google API, Facebook conversion API etc. What's  in it for you? column2: Building on our past.  Ready for the future              Worley is a global professional services company of energy,  chemicals and resources experts.  We partner with customers to deliver projects and create value over the life of their assets.  We re bridging two worlds,  moving towards more sustainable energy sources,  while helping to provide the energy,  chemicals and resources needed now.               Position: Senior Technical Consultant,  Process Technology.                   Worley consulting is seeking a consultant to work within our Power to X service line part of our Chemicals and Fuels practice.      The candidate(s) will be a member of the team providing strategic consulting services to the power,  refining,  chemicals and financial sectors.  The role will initially be focusing predominantly on Power to X technologies and clients but have exposure to all sectors as opportunities arise.                    The experienced candidate will demonstrate extensive knowledge of more than one of the following activities:                                  Techno-economic concept and feasibility studies,                                   Process technology (Ammonia,  Methanol,  Hydrogen along with synthesis gas generation technologies or SAF) and/or Operations experience,                                    Project implementation and monitoring,                                    Capital investments.                   The role provides opportunities to tailor bespoke services to suit a diverse set of clients,  working to deliver services,  participating in business development and to be a key member of the practice.                   Responsibilities and Key Accountabilities:                  Proactively provide support and assistance,  across a broad range of projects and tasks,  that will from time to time include working on the following:                                Feasibility studies for major greenfield / brownfield Power to X investments;                                  Sustainability and energy transition projects across the downstream sector,  including Power to X;                                  Consulting services during all phases of an engagement,  including benchmarking,  gap analysis,  solution identification,  justification,  prioritization,  ranking,  implementation and close out;                                  Licensor screening and selection;                                  Assistance to specialist teams with lenders advisory activities;                                  Support our single-client market services offering;                                  Assist with teams marketing and business development activities for consulting services and support the growth of the business,  including developing proposals                      Experience                   The candidate must demonstrate competency and experience in the following:                                  Able to work within a  sell-do  model;                                  Strong self-starter and motivated to succeed;                                  Practical consulting experience   including scoping,  selling and delivery;                                  Experience of Chemicals technologies,  with preference for Ammonia,  Methanol or SAF;                                  Excellent communication skills including ability to produce concise reports and presentations appropriate for all levels;                                  Confidence to work at all levels of a client organization;                                  Desire to expand role and be adaptable to client s needs;                                  Support the preparation of proposals,  execution plans and budgets;                                  Supports a continuous improvement culture and identifies gaps,  develops work processes,  tools and methodologies to drive productivity and growth.                   The candidate should ideally also be able to demonstrate experience in one or more of the following services areas:                                  Feasibility and configuration studies,                                   Process understanding and modelling,                                   Industry competitiveness/awareness,                                   Power to X integration,  from Power Generation through to X production,                                   Technology vendors/licensors,  evaluation and selection                                  Petrochemical asset operations,                                   Financial analysis,                                       Technical due diligence.

To enable new customers with technical knowledge and provide guidance on Unit4 ERP available technology for integrations, extensions, and advanced reporting.          Ensure all work is undertaken to recognized Argano quality standards. Education and Experience:           Bachelor s degree with required minimum 3-5 years in technologies used in systems integrations is required         Knowledge of Unit4 ERP and its reporting and integrations tools is preferred.         Ideal candidate should have four (4) to six (6) years of experience working in a fast-paced environment. Experience working with Microsoft Office is required.
